summaryText: Pastor Travis Hearn delivers a powerful message about removing the masks we wear in life and confronting the spirit of perfectionism. Isn't it amazing how we often hide behind facades, pretending everything is perfect when our hearts are truly struggling? PT breaks down four key problems with perfectionism: the need for control, a critical and judgmental heart, being a people pleaser, and having artificial self-esteem. He challenges us to trust God completely, reminding us that our confidence should be rooted in Christ alone, not in human approval or worldly achievements. The sermon is a wake-up call to authenticity, urging us to stop trying to impress others and instead focus on pleasing God. Pastor Travis uses humor and personal stories to drive home the point that God loves us exactly as we are - no masks needed! The most powerful moment? When he reminds us that we are God's masterpiece, fearfully and wonderfully made. This message is a breath of fresh air for anyone struggling with the pressure to appear perfect.
mainPoints: Perfectionism is a spiritual trap that prevents us from trusting God
Our true identity is found in Christ, not in human approval
Remove the masks and embrace who God created you to be

versesMentioned.text: We refuse to wear masks and play games. We don't maneuver and manipulate behind the scenes.
You can't keep your true self hidden forever before long you will be exposed.
Jesus repeatedly uses the word 'hypocrite' to describe those who appear righteous externally but are corrupt internally.
Seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.
Those who trust in themselves are fools, but those who walk in wisdom are kept safe.
Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding; in all your ways submit to him, and he will make your paths straight.
Fear of human opinion disables; trusting the LORD protects you from danger.
Our purpose is to please God, not people. He alone examines the motives of our hearts.
Am I now trying to win the approval of human beings, or of God? Or am I trying to please people? If I were still trying to please people, I would not be a servant of Christ.
Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid of them. The LORD your God goes with you; he will never leave you nor forsake you.

Monday.scripture: Psalm 139:14: 'I praise you because I am fearfully and wonderfully made; your works are wonderful, I know that full well.'
Monday.action: Write down three unique qualities about yourself that you believe God specifically designed in you. Reflect on how these qualities can be used to glorify Him.
Monday.prayer: Lord, help me see myself through Your eyes. Remove the masks I've been wearing and help me embrace the unique person You created me to be. Give me the courage to be authentic and trust in Your perfect design. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: 1 Samuel 16:7: 'The LORD does not look at the things people look at. People look at the outward appearance, but the LORD looks at the heart.'
Tuesday.focus: Understanding true worth comes from God
Tuesday.action: Identify one area where you've been seeking human approval. Spend time in prayer, surrendering that area to God and asking Him to reshape your perspective.
Tuesday.prayer: Heavenly Father, forgive me for seeking validation from others instead of from You. Help me find my worth in Your love and not in human opinions. Transform my heart to seek only Your approval. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Ephesians 2:10: 'For we are God's handiwork, created in Christ Jesus to do good works, which God prepared in advance for us to do.'
Wednesday.action: List three ways you can serve others this week without seeking recognition. Look for opportunities to serve quietly and humbly.
Wednesday.prayer: Lord, help me to serve not for human praise, but out of love for You. Show me ways I can demonstrate Your love without seeking attention or approval. Make me a vessel of Your grace. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: Galatians 1:10: 'Am I now trying to win the approval of human beings, or of God? Or am I trying to please people? If I were still trying to please people, I would not be a servant of Christ.'
Thursday.action: Identify one situation where you've been compromising your integrity to please others. Develop a plan to respond authentically and with grace.
Thursday.prayer: God, give me the courage to be true to You, even when it's uncomfortable. Help me prioritize Your opinion over the opinions of others. Fill me with Your strength and wisdom. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Proverbs 29:25: 'Fear of human opinion disables; trusting the LORD protects you from danger.'
Friday.focus: Breaking free from fear of judgment
Friday.action: Practice saying 'no' to something that you would normally do just to please others. Set a healthy boundary that honors God.
Friday.prayer: Father, break the chains of people-pleasing in my life. Help me find my security in Your love, not in human validation. Give me wisdom to set healthy boundaries with grace. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Romans 12:2: 'Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind.'
Saturday.action: Do a social media detox. Replace scrolling time with Scripture reading and prayer, focusing on your identity in Christ.
Saturday.prayer: Lord, renew my mind and help me see myself as You see me. Remove the worldly standards that cloud my vision. Transform me from the inside out and help me walk in true freedom. Amen.
